I get this all the time in I20070201-0800. I tried to debug it, but I got nowhere, since the debugger always crashed with this problem.

However, what I could definitely see is that ChildrenUpdate.performUpdate(ChildrenUpdate.java:70) calls viewer.insert(..) with a wrong insertIndex. In my scenario (which involves 2 big workspaces), I see that the parent SWT TreeItem has only 26 children, but insertIndex is 27 (1 too high).
Any steps to reproduce would be helpful.
Hooray, I have a setup to reproduce! Will write down steps in a minute.

The scenario is drawn from my setup to find bug 172524, so it might not work with later builds.

Steps with N20070202-0010 and JDK 1.5.0:

- have a development workspace (I call it "debugger") with all the relevant plug-ins (swt, jface, debug) loaded

- run "target" with:
eclipse.exe -data target -consolelog -showlocation -vmargs -agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,suspend=n,server=y,address=localhost:51040

- in "target", open Plug-ins view, select all, context menu > Add to Java Search

- run "middle" with:
eclipse.exe -data middle -consolelog -showlocation -vmargs -agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,suspend=n,server=y,address=localhost:51020

- in "middle":
  - add all plug-ins to Java search
  - set these line breakpoints:
      SaveManager line 970
      SaveManager line 1191
      SaveManager line 1202
      Workspace line 1821
  - go to Debug perspective
  - create and debug a "Remote Java Application" launch configuration with
      project "External Plug-in Libraries" and port 51040

- in "debugger":
  - set breakpoint on TreeItem line 222, set condition to "return hItem == 0;"
  - create and debug a "Remote Java Application" launch configuration with
      port 51020

- click close box of workbench window "target" and click "OK" to exit.

- in "middle", press F8 whenever you hit a breakpoint

=> After about 4 hits, "target" closes and the breakpoint in "debugger" is hit.
Now, index is 2, and parentItem.getItemCount() is 0.

I also got the bug when I launched the "middle" Eclipse as a normal "Eclipse Application" debug target, but the link from "middle" to "target" needs to be a "Remote Java Application" to reproduce.
Can you re-attach your most recent stack trace, the original one on this bug report no longer matches line numbers in the source. Thanks.

The problem happens when threads for a terminated target are being updated after the target has already terminated, when the 'show system threads' filter is filtering system threads.

The viewer's content provider maintains a mapping of which children are filtered. When a node's child count is set to 0 or a node's 'hasChildren' property is false, the filtered chidlren for that node are cleared. However, when an element's child count was set to a non-zero value, we did not clear any filters for items above that count (for example, a node changes from 10 to 5 children and items 7 and 8 were previuosly filtered). Updating the filter indicies fixes this problem, as we no longer attempt the insert.

Changes to:
ChildrenCountUpdate
FilterTransform
ModelContentProvider
Please verify, Mike.

I don't have a fix for this yet. Workaround is not to filter system threads.

Created an attachment (id=58494)
patch

I have a patch for this, but I want to wait for M6 to release it. 

We are not properly updating filtered indexes when an element (thread in this case) is removed from the model. We simply remove the element from the viewer but to not update filter indexes accordinly (remove the filtered element, if it is filtered, or decrement indexes of other element now that an element is removed).

This patch adds support to update filter indexes appropriately. When the index of the removed element is not known, the parent has to be refreshed and filtered elements are recomputed. This adds some flash to viewer as threads off the bottom of the viewer are removed.

patch
